DataElement.preferredName: New Lesion Equivocal Assessment Requiring Follow-up Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator of whether there are equivocal new lesion(s) that require follow-up [manually curated].

DataElementConcept.preferredName: New Lesion Equivocal Assessment Requirement Follow-up
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Open to question._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory._The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: New; having no previous example or precedent or parallel.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Open to question.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
Something that is a necessary condition; something that is obligatory.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Needed new DEC for new CDE: "Are there new equivocal lesion(s) that require follow-up?"; Released during quarterly metrics clean up_12.03.20

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.
